result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl D Mire was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (1st w/Pass.), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at rate of $50.00 commencing 11/01/2015 or penalty of 5 days jail for non-payment.

Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 74 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 6.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Fine/costs to be paid at rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/01/2015 or penalty of 11 days Huber for non-payment.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Waukesha City Police Department.

Huber with standard release conditions.  Sentence credit for 74 days were granted.
Concurrent with: Count 4.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

Hearing at 09-08-2015 01:30 pm
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Cases 15CM1104 and 15CM1105 called.  Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts # 4 and 6.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Counts # 1,2,3 and 5 are dismissed and read in.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Klein makes statements.  Defendant makes statements.  

The Court Orders the Following:
Count # 4 
Sentence of 60 days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS concurrent to Count #6.  (Credit - 74 days) .  
FINE:  $243.00 
DNA Surcharge: $200.00  
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

The Court Orders the Following:
Count # 6
Sentence of 
90 days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS concurrent to Count #4.  (Credit - 74 days).  
FINE:  $1179.00 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to City of Waukesha Police Department.
DL REVOCATION:  15 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 15 months.

Fines in Count # 4 and 6 are to be paid at a rate of $50.00 a month commencing 10/1/2015.  Alternate:  11 days in huber for nonpayment of the fine.

Cases 15CM1104 and 15CM1105 called for a jury status hearing.  Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.   Melissa Zilavy and Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Klein advises these matters will be going forward to a jury trial.  Court will hear case # 15CM1105 on 9/1/2015.  15CM1104 will remain on the calendar as a hearing and determine where to proceed with that case at that time.  Court will allow the defendant to wear street clothing for trial.  Court will address the motions in limine the morning of 9/1/2015.  Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury status hearing on August 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Darryl D Mire in court, in custody, with attorney Jessica Klein.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court addresses the speedy trial demand statues.  60 days would be next week regarding the speedy trial request.  The state will not be prepared to go forward next week. The state did not have notice to a speedy trial notice until last weeks notice on 8/7/2015 by the defendant.  The defendant wishes to have a trial next week.  Court addresses the witnesses each party will have for the jury trial.  Attorney Klein makes statements, allowing the state to have a few weeks to prepare for trial due to the defendants late speedy trial request.  Court grants a continuance by the request of the State, due to the lateness of the speedy trial demand.  Court schedules a jury trial for a sooner date.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
